intro: Adinandra integerrima var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
